The Lost Road and Other Writings

wikitext.*:
'''''óre''''' is a [[Quenya]] word meaning:

#"heart (inner mind)"<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref><ref group=note>The term ''óre'', despite being translated as "heart", does not have the same meaning as in English: it does not correspond to the physical organ, memory, reflection, emotion, feelings or positive impulses. The ''óre'' is a conscience or instinct that advises or warns the [[Incarnate]]s to proper courses  of action. (Cf. {{VT|41c}}, p. 11-2)</ref>
#"to urge"{{fact}}
#"rising" (noun)<ref name=LR>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 379</ref>

===Other forms===
*(as noun) ''órenya'' "my heart"<ref name="VT41:11">{{VT|41c}}, p. 11</ref>
*(as verb) ''Óre'' "(it) urges"{{fact}}

===Examples===
*''Óre nin'' "I am urged"{{fact}}

===Etymology===
In the manuscript "[[Vinyar Tengwar 41|Notes on Óre]]", ''óre'' ("heart (inner mind)") derives from the [[Common Eldarin]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[ƷOR]]. The word is also said to be associated with the root [[OR]], although probably not "semantically connected".<ref name="VT41:11"/>

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']], the word ''óre'' ("rising") derives from root [[OR#Other versions|ORO]].<ref name=LR/>

===Cognates===
*[[Telerin]] ''[[ōre]]''
*[[Sindarin]] ''[[gûr]]''

==Tengwa==
[[Image:Ore.gif|left]]''Óre'' is also the name in Quenya of the twenty-first letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the first letter of the sixth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "semi-vocalic" consonants and it is the sixth letter in the dental or ''t''-series of consonants, the ''[[Tincotéma]]''.  In most modes this letter represents weak or untrilled '''R''' (usually used medially or at the end of words).<ref>{{App|Letters}}</ref>  However, in the [[Mode of Beleriand]], as in the inscription on the [[Doors of Durin|West-gate]] of [[Moria]], this letter represents '''N'''.<ref>{{App|Letters}}, footnote 2</ref>  The Westron name for this letter is '''''Ar'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>
